page.title: 07Farming in Ripe
page.content: Farming is, and always will be, the main occupation around Ripe. There are no really large farms, mainly holdings of 60 to 600 acres. Most farmers specialise in one aspect of farming. The old farmers had a milk herd, a few hens and pigs and other livestock. They grew the crops to feed them. There are some dairy farms, the largest of which is Middle Farm, Firle. Here most of the farm is intensively farmed grassland, with some arable and a little rough grazing. The herd is Freisians and give a good yield of rich milk. The smaller farmers often keep bullocks for their meat. All cattle are kept out in the fields during the drier months, usually May to October. In winter the cattle are kept in barns and fed with hay silage and cereals.
